results.title: Splendour in the grass
results.creator_credit: Elia Kazan and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Deanie (Natalie Wood) is a beautiful teenager eager to do what is right in her staunchly moral hometown, in the 1920’s but the emotions she shares with her boyfriend, Bud (Warren Beatty) are too strong to ignore. Eventually the conflict between what society expects and what their desires demand pushes Bud to physical collapse and Deanie to madness. The young stars bring freshness and intensity to this story of parental domination, moral codes and young love, directed with insight and power by Elia Kazan.

results.title: Aunt Julia and the scriptwriter
results.creator_credit: Jon Amiel, John Fiedler, Mark Tarlov, Cinecom Entertainment and Odyssey
results.brief_description: Released in the United States as “Tune in tomorrow”, this is John Amiel’s screen version of Mario Vargas Llosa’s acclaimed novel “Aunt Julia and the scriptwriter”. Aunt Julia (Barbara Hershey), a double divorcee, returns to New Orleans at age 36 to find a wealthy third husband. Instead, she finds her 21-year-old nephew by marriage (Keanu Reeves), a local radio station newswriter, who falls in love with her. She succumbs to his advances, incurring her family’s anger. The plot is overlaid with the more complicated story of a dishevelled writer, Falk, who is new in town. Falk manipulates the nephew-aunt relationship in his radio soap opera which is laced with incest and anti-Albanian sentiment. This is a clever and witty romantic comedy that features an amazing supporting cast including John Laroquette, Elizabeth McGovern, Dennis Quaid and others.

results.title: The Miraculous Mellops 2. Part 3
results.creator_credit: Karl Zwicky, Posie Graeme-Evans, Film Australia and Millenium Pictures
results.brief_description: Using the Intergalatic phone book, the Mellops use the WOOP to go to Planet Peaceful where the Grubs have caused havoc. Sam and Mike get WOOPed aboard the Grub Spaceship where they try to unsuccessfully gain access to the WOOP manual. The grubs try to eat Dump but he tastes so awful that they let him go. The return to Earth is not a pleasant experience and Dump makes it back in his underpants.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Karl Zwicky, Posie Graeme-Evans, Film Australia and Millenium Pictures

results.title: Family history: getting started
results.creator_credit: Geoff Russell and Video Education Australasia
results.brief_description: Searching for clues to their ancestral past has become a popular hobby and pastime for many Australians. Featuring expert input from Frances Brown, (Genealogy and Local History - State Library of Victoria) this program demonstrates how to begin researching your family history. We look at why people seek the information, how they go about it, and the skills needed to complete an accurate family history project.

results.title: Blade runner (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Ridley Scott, Michael Deeley, Bud Yorkin, Jerry Perenchio, Ladd Company and Sir Run Run Shaw
results.brief_description: Ridley Scott’s adaptation of Philip K. Dick’s novel “Do androids dream of electric sheep” has rapidly become a classic of the science fiction genre. In Los Angeles, 2019, Deckard, a licensed-to-kill cop is given the task of tracking down and destroying a group of intelligent androids who have hijacked a space shuttle and returned to earth. In the process Deckard has to confront disturbing questions about what makes a human being. “A richly detailed and visually overwhelming trip to the future which sticks with you like a recurrent nightmare.” Stars Harrison Ford, Rutger Hauer and Sean Young.

results.title: Holding our ground
results.creator_credit: Anne Henderson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This is the inspiring story of a group of Filipino women and their efforts to acquire land of their own in the post-Marcos era. It looks at the plight of a group of women on the outskirts of Cebu, the second largest city in the Phillipines, who make their living as sidewalk sellers. Their story unfolds in the political arena of the Aquino Government, whose promises for land reform have never materialised. Interweaved with their struggle is the story of the evergrowing population of streetkids who beg and their struggle to survive. This is a powerful example of women and children, traditionally viewed as powerless, taking the future into their own hands.

results.title: Multimedia: opportunities for Australia
results.creator_credit: Laura Zusters, Ben Cardillo and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A forum in which members of the Australian multimedia industry discuss opportunities and issues affecting the development of their industry. This program will be helpful for companies, policy makers, educational institutions and industry analysts wishing to gain an overview of those in the Australian small business community developing multimedia products.

results.title: Against all odds: the story of Australia's North West Shelf Gas Project
results.creator_credit: The Film House and Woodside Petroleum Ltd
results.brief_description: Traces the development of the North West Shelf Gas Project from the discovery of natural gas reserves in the 1970’s to the commissioning of a second off-shore platform in 1995. Highlights the successful export of liquefied natural gas to Japan.

results.title: World of Apu = World of Apu
results.creator_credit: Satyajit Ray and Satyajit Ray Production
results.brief_description: The third in the Apu trilogy, the scene opens in Calcutta, where Apu, now a jobless ex-student, dreams of becoming a writer. Extracted from this insular environment, Apu’s life changes when he visits a village and exchanges himself for the mad bridegroom. After his wife’s death during childbirth, Apu leaves Calcutta. His life becomes one filled with indifference. Apu’s journey back to the world is painful but ultimately fulfilling. This is a moving film, considered to be one of Ray’s best, perhaps because the theme is so profound: that without death there cannot be life. The music by Ravi Shankar adds to the film’s power. Based on the text by Bibhutibhusan Banerji.

results.title: Olympic glory the golden years: Aussies and Kiwis in sport
results.creator_credit: Denis Phelan, James Murray and Golden Years
results.brief_description: Featuring remarkable achievements from athletes the like of; Betty Cithbert, Australai’s “Golden Girl” who was only 18 when she smashed the Olympic record for the 100m dashand took home three gold medals; Dawn Fraser, the first Olympic swimmer of either sex to win the same event three times; Raelene Boyle, the super sprinter twice runner-up in the 200m track event, beaten by world record wins each time,; and Jack Lovelock who scored an incredible victory in one of the most hotly contested 1500m finals in Olympic history. Porduction based on the Big Fights Olympic library.
